content: 2dc in 1st st double_crochet across until 1 st remains 2dc in last st 38 row 6 chain 2 turn double_crochet in 1st st *chain 1 skip 1 double_crochet 1* across until 1 st remains double_crochet in last st 38 row 7 chain 2 turn double_crochet in every st and chain space across 38 row 8 chain 2 turn double_crochet in 1st st *skip 1 double_crochet 1 double_crochet in skip st* across until 1 st remains double_crochet in last st 38 row 9 chain 2 turn double_crochet across 38 grindstone tote bag - july 2021 - downeast collection - @taralovescrochet repeat row 6-9 two more times front panel row 18 chain 1 turn single_crochet across do not fasten_off back panel row 18 includes button loop chain 1 turn single_crochet 19 chain 18 single_crochet 19 38 single_crochet 18 chain do not fasten_off if you d prefer a bag with no button back panel row 18 make two of the front panel continue single_crochet around the outside edges of the panel placing 1sc in the end of the single_crochet row 2 single_crochet in the end of each double_crochet row and 1 single_crochet in each st of the foundation chain fasten_off grindstone tote bag - july 2021 - downeast collection - @taralovescrochet place a stitch marker in each of the two center stitches at the bottom of each panel side/bottom/strap panel switch to 6mm hook or smaller hook row 1 chain 11 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook single_crochet across 10 row 2 chain 1 turn single_crochet across 10 row 3-50 repeat row 2 place stitch markers at both ends of row 50 row 51 chain 1 turn decrease single_crochet in next 6 sts decrease 8 row 52 chain 1 turn single_crochet across 8 row 53-149 repeat row 52 row 150 chain 1 turn 2sc in 1st st single_crochet across until 1 st remains 2sc in last st 10 place stitch markers at both ends of row 150 row 151 chain 1 turn single_crochet across 10 row 152-200 repeat row 151 **for longer or shorter strap add or subtract row between row 53 and 149 ** grindstone tote bag - july 2021 - downeast collection - @taralovescrochet assembly 1 with right sides facing - using the st markers placed at row 50 and 150 of strap attach the strap panel to the top corners of one of the bag panels 2 using the stitch markers at the bottom center of the bag panel attach the ends of the strap to the bag panel 3 starting at the bottom center single_crochet the panel and strap together continuing around the edge of the strap and down the other side of the panel slip_stitch into 1st st to join fasten_off grindstone tote bag - july 2021 - downeast collection - @taralovescrochet repeat for the other side panel using tail sew the bottom of the bag closed i used a mattress stitch but any seaming method will work finishing weave in all ends sew a large button
